item.title: You said it has been fixed - no work been done, 9th February
item.description:
This is all the photos I took walking from Oarchard Road to Abbots Leys Road just after I recived the "Fixed" report. Please indicate which is fixed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnmeadow Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous parkong, 9th February
item.description:
Parking on blind corners on both sides of the road. Really needs double yellows, parking too close to the traffic calming making near impossible to get through and then causing dangerous reversing back towards a blind corner and junction. Kids crossing after school is risky. Seems worse today as HSL sports event but always an element of danger in this area. Please make safe before an accident happens and prior to another few hundred cars move to the Miller estate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over 20 pot holes within a couple of doors of mine, 9th February
item.description:
On report 8748907 you said fix & no work has been done Some are in your emergency category When are they going to be fixed or is this to be closed with no work done as well?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnmeadow Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All of the sandyleaze road from the premier shop down to the school is covered in really dangerous pot holes that have been reported several times and had nothing done and could cause serious damage to cars, 9th February
item.description:
The whole of sandyleaze but there’s 3 quite bad and deep pot holes just outside the turning to Old Richians RFC something needs to be done about it asap even if it’s just filled with tarmac for a permanent fix because if it damages someone’s car they will be coming for the council yet it’s been reported so many times been in a bad way for months probably even years now!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakleaze, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover on the pedestrian island near Toby carvery, 9th February
item.description:
There is a loose manhole cover on Shurdington Road (coming into Brockworth) on the pedestrian crossing island just before the turning to Toby Carvery car parked. It’s incredibly loud and disturbing residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Painswick Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole opposite long scarred pothole which has recently been part repaired, 9th February
item.description:
The pothole has appeared as traffic has moved closer to the pavement to avoid the 2 long scar like potholes on n the way out of the dip. The traffic parked n the opposite side of the road because of a house build are forcing traffic into the pothole.

item.title: Signage left behind after works completed, 9th February
item.description:
There is some signage which had been left behind for a couple of months now following works at this location. It is to the side of the bus stop on Pirton Lane, at the junction with Winston Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: The ditch at the side of the lane is partially blocked causing the stream to overflow onto the road every time the water level increases following rain., 9th February
item.description:
What Three Words : leaned.satellite.worksheet This is an ongoing issue that results in mud and stone on the road surface, very muddy verges and water run off going all the way down to The Roundhouse and onto the newly resurfaced Ermin Way. I suspect that the stream ditch needs clearing out all the way along the lane to avoid this issue simply repeating itself.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Broken slab & trip hazards, 9th February
item.description:
There are a number of issues with the paving outside no 40. A paving slab is damaged causing a severe trip hazard. There have also been a number of falls when tripping on the uneven slabs and raised man hole/drain cover.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
